channel.title: Georgina (Georgy) Falster on My New Hugo Site
channel.description: Recent content in Georgina (Georgy) Falster on My New Hugo Site

item.title: About me
item.description: clouds restore in rain the exhalations of the land and sea -H. W. Longfellow This snippet from Longfellow’s prelude to Michael Angelo describes the water cycle: the movement of water around the Earth. I am a climate scientist, tackling the same topic but using science. I try to understand the huge range of factors influencing when, where, and why rain falls in different places around the world - and how that is changing because of climate change.

item.title: News
item.description: 22 September 2025 In a truly bizarre turn of events, I am exceptionally lucky to be one of the four recipients of a 2025 Australia/NZ L’Or√©al-UNESCO For Women In Science Fellowship. These awards - as well as being prestigious, generous, and highly competitive - come with a fancy award ceremony and the opportunity to mentor the next generation of scientists through the For Girls in Science forum. The grant comes at a perfect time as I’m waging a one-girl campaign to establish my own little holistic climate research lab - I’ll use the money to buy tree ring analysis equipment as well as to visit collaborators and head to San Francisco for AGU in 2026.

item.title: Research
item.description: Publications on Google Scholar Link to my Google Scholar profile Published Journal Articles Vaiglova, P., H. Kierdorf, C. Witzel, G. Falster, R. Joannes-Boyau, Y. Wang, J. Wu, I. Williams, B. Knowles, Y. Wu, P. Bangsgaard, L. Yeomans, T. Richter, H. Darabi. 2025. Transport of animals underpinned ritual feasting at the onset of the Neolithic in southwestern Asia. Communications Earth & Environment 6: Article 519. Link to publication. Cho, P., G. Falster, D.

item.title: CV
item.description: Full curriculum vitae Current Affiliation DECRA Fellow The University of Adelaide Using climate model simulations, rainwater isotopes, weather observations, and tree ring isotopes for a holistic understanding of Australian droughts and how they are changing. Previous Affiliations ARC Centre of Excellence for Climate Extremes postdoctoral fellow The Australian National University I combined information from modern observational data and model simulations to better understand the dynamics and drivers of Australian drought.

item.title: Contact
item.description: Journalists: please see my Scimex profile. Otherwise, my contact details are available from my institutional profile. Here I am with my favourite instrument - the Picarro L2140-i cavity ring-down spectroscopy water isotope analyser.
